bug.summary: Logging to progress bar doesn't work when calling trainer.test()
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
The metric logged by EvalResult.log() doesn't show up in the progress bar when setting prog_bar=True. <denchmark-h:h4>Code sample</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>import time import torch import torch.nn as nn import torch.nn.functional as F from torch.utils.data import TensorDataset, DataLoader import pytorch_lightning as pl
class MyModel(pl.LightningModule): def __init__(self): super(MyModel, self).__init__() self.layer = nn.Linear(64, 1)
def forward(self, x): return self.layer(x)
def test_step(self, batch, batch_idx): X, y = batch loss = F.mse_loss(self.forward(X), y)
result = pl.EvalResult() result.log("test_loss", loss, prog_bar=True) time.sleep(1) return result
test_ds = TensorDataset(torch.randn(64 * 5, 64), torch.randn(64 * 5, 1)) test_loader = DataLoader(test_ds, batch_size=64)
model = MyModel() trainer = pl.Trainer(logger=False) trainer.test(model, test_dataloaders=test_loader) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
test_loss shows up in the progress bar when running the above script. <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
PyTorch Version: 1.6 OS: Linux How you installed PyTorch: pip Python version: 3.8.5

comments.comment: logging metrics to the progress bar when running over the test or validation set doesn't make sense. You should compute the metric over the whole dataset and report it at the end.

I wanted to quickly check if the batch testing results were sensible or not, so I think that's one possible use case. But if this is by design, then why even include on_step and on_epoch in EvalResult().log? What are the intended behaviors for these parameters?
